content: plummery cardigan description this is a simple easy-to-knit easy-to-wear relaxed-fit cropped cardigan it requires minimal seaming at the shoulders only it is knit in one piece from the bottom up with sleeves picked up and knit in the round the name is inspired by the plum color of the sample and green mountain spinnery s mountain mohair yarn materials us size 10 5 6 5 mm 32 inch circular needle for the body and one 16 inch circular or equivalent dpns if preferred for the sleeves - or whatever size needles needed to obtain gauge us size 9 5 5 mm 9 inch circular or dpns for sleeve cuff removable stitch marker for sleeve bor and 2 locking stitch markers for back neck tapestry needle ***note - i am a very tight knitter and generally go up one or two needle sizes to get gauge keep this in mind when you are swatching yarn green mountain spinnery s mountain mohair in blue violet- 2 oz/58 g -140yds/128m or any worsted weight yarn that meets gauge yardage approximate xs - 800 yds 732 m s - 931 yds 851 m m - 1011 yds 924m l - 1113 yds 1018 m xl -1219 yds 1115 m 2xl - 1324 yds 1211 m 3xl - 1540 yds 1409 m # of skeins of green mountain spinnery mountain mohair - 6 7 8 8 9 10 11 gauge approximately 14 stitches/ 22 row per 4x4 inches 10x10 cm stockinette stitch wet-blocked knit flat finished measurements with recommended positive ease of 6 - 10 inches 15 - 25 cm sizes - xs s m l xl 2xl 3xl bust circumference finished measurements 36 41 45 50 55 59 66 inches 91 104 114 127 140 150 167 cm total length 20 21 21 22 23 23 24 inches 51 53 53 56 58 58 61 cm abbreviations k - knit p - purl *k2tog* - knit 2 stitches together across the round stst - stockinette stitch puk - pick up and knit ws - wrong side *k1tbl p* -*k through the back loop p* across the row bor - beginning of round dpns - double-pointed needles body with larger needle cast on 128 144 160 176 192 208 232 stitches work *k1tbl p* rib for 5 inches 13 cm change to stst and work an additional 7 5 8 8 8 5 9 9 9 5 inches 19 20 20 22 23 23 24 cm end with ws row split for armholes and left and right front sections right front panel k across 28 32 36 40 44 48 54 stitches turn and p back then work stst on these right front stitches for 7 5 8 8 8 5 9 9 9 5 inches 19 20 20 22 23 23 24 cm end with ws row bind off back panel attach yarn and k the next 72 80 88 96 104 112 124 stitches for back panel turn and p back then work
